pages.text: $(italic)You've already used your anvil - lots of anvils, to be precise - plenty. However, both $(l:general/anvil_crushing)Anvil Crushing$(/l) and repairing and enchanting tools always damage them so quickly that they become irreparably damaged.$(br)To make the anvil more stable - or even indestructible - you need a harder material. Bedrock seems like the perfect choice.
The Bedrock Anvil allows you to rename items for a cost of zero. In addition, you can also add descriptions to your items.$(br2)$(italic)Tip: you can use "\n" to split your text into multiple lines.

Of course an anvil made of Bedrock has another distinct advantage over normal anvils:$(br)It is indestructible, making it a perfect candidate for usage in $(l:general/anvil_crushing)Anvil Crushing$() automation or mass enchantment actions.
